home.headerSubtitleBottom: Regional Transformation Network for the Automotive and Supplier Industry
home.welcomeDescription: ReTraNetz-BB is a network that supports companies in the automotive and supplier industry.
home.digitalAssistanceDescription: Digital assistants support employees in production by providing targeted information.
home.energyMonitoringDescription: Innovative manufacturing technologies enable effective energy management within research.
home.digitallyIntegratedProductionDescription: Digitally integrated production optimizes manufacturing processes through the use of modern technologies.

digitalAssistance.headerSubtitleBottom: Efficient Process Automation and Intelligent Support
digitalAssistance.digitalAssistanceDescription: Discover new opportunities to optimize your workflows and improve your efficiency through tailored solutions.
digitalAssistance.assemblyDescription: Learn the assembly process step by step to minimize errors.
digitalAssistance.chatbotDescription: Use Chatbot to quickly get answers to your questions.

assembly.headerSubtitle: Assemble two components using a guide for efficient process automation, or use our chatbot for additional support.
assembly.assemblyDescription: Check the availability and status of the 3D-printed parts to proceed with the assembly and keep the process efficient.
assembly.electricalMotorHousingDescription: The housing for the electrical motor must be assembled precisely to ensure optimal performance.
assembly.electricalMotorDescription: The electric motor is a central component of the assembly. Make sure all parts are ready for installation.

underDevelopment.note: This section is currently under development. Please check back later for detailed content.

stator.name: Stator
stator.desc: The stator generates the magnetic field in the motor and enables the rotor to rotate.

laminatedCore.name: Laminated Core
laminatedCore.desc: The laminated core minimizes eddy current losses and improves motor efficiency.

rotor.name: Rotor
rotor.desc: The rotor rotates within the stator's magnetic field and generates the required motion.

shaft.name: Shaft
shaft.desc: The shaft transmits the rotor's rotary motion to the drive gear and other components.

housing.name: Housing
housing.desc: The housing protects internal parts of the motor and provides mechanical stability.

finalAssembly.name: Final Assembly
finalAssembly.desc: All parts are assembled and tested to ensure functionality.

wireInsulation.name: Wire Insulation
desc: The copper winding is coated with varnish to prevent short circuits.
The coating slightly reduces the slot fill factor.

slotInsulation.name: Slot Insulation
desc: Sheet stacks are insulated in the slots using insulation paper to protect the copper winding.
This prevents voltage flashovers and damage from sharp edges.

roundWire.name: Round Wire
desc: Round wire is made from copper.
It is produced through a sequence of drawing and rolling wire rods.

flatWire.name: Flat Wire
desc: Utilizes hairpin technology.
Achieves a higher slot fill factor.
Improves motor efficiency.

impregnation.name: Impregnation
desc: After winding, the coils are impregnated with resin to improve electrical insulation, thermal conductivity, and mechanical strength.
The impregnation process uses specialized resin materials.

cuttingSheets.name: Cutting Sheets
cuttingSheets.desc: In production, laser cutting and follow-up cutting are used for cutting the sheets.

stackingSheets.name: Stacking Sheets
stackingSheets.desc: Punch-stacking the sheets and insulating them with bonding varnish are key processes in the manufacturing of traction motors.

insulation.name: Insulation
desc: Insulation of the manufactured poles.

winding.name: Winding
desc: Winding of the poles.
Linear, needle, or flyer winding methods are used.

commutator.name: Commutator
desc: Assembly of the commutator.
The commutator enables continuous power supply to the rotor.
Assembly is carried out using axial joining.

contacting.name: Contacting
desc: Connection of the copper slip rings to the DC power source.

impregnation.name: Impregnation
desc: Impregnation of the windings with resin to enhance insulation and mechanical strength.

electricalTesting.name: Electrical Testing
desc: Testing of the windings using trial energization or inductive testing methods.
The commutator enables continuous energization of the rotor during operation.

magnetAssembly.name: Magnet Assembly
desc: Mounting of magnets in a non-magnetized state.

magnetFixation.name: Magnet Fixation
desc: Magnets are inserted using adhesive bonding or mechanical fixation methods.
The process can be performed manually or automatically on the magnets or in the laminated core slots.
Curing then takes place at temperatures between 20°C and 200°C.

magnetization.name: Magnetization
desc: Performed after assembly.
The commutator ensures continuous energization of the rotor through a multi-coil excitation system.
